pair.t: City officials fired the captain of the crashed Staten Island ferry.
pair.h: Staten Island ferry captain has refused to talk with investigators.

pair.t: Budapest again became the focus of national political drama in the late 1980s, when Hungary led the reform movement in eastern Europe that broke the communist monopoly on political power and ushered in the possibility of multiparty politics.
pair.h: In the late 1980s Budapest became the center of the reform movement.

pair.t: In Wednesday's filing, Google said it planned to complete the IPO "as soon as practicable."
pair.h: It's unclear whether Wednesday's twist will affect the timing of Google's initial public offering.

pair.t: Al-Jazeera broadcasts to millions of Arab viewers from headquarters in Doha, Qatar.
pair.h: Al-Jazeera has occasionally run into problems with authorities in other Arab countries.

pair.t: The new study refutes earlier findings by researchers at the University of California, Los Angeles, who concluded that the odds of getting head and neck cancers rose in tandem with the frequency and duration of marijuana use.
pair.h: The latest findings contradict a California study that implicated regular pot smoking as having markedly higher risks for head and neck cancers.

pair.t: Kessler's team conducted 60,643 face-to-face interviews with adults in 14 countries.
pair.h: Kessler's team interviewed more than 60,000 adults in 14 countries.

pair.t: Investigators described the gunman as white, about 30 years old, of medium build with shoulder-length, wavy blond hair and as having a "scruffy" or "grunge" appearance.
pair.h: The gunman is described as a white male in his 30s with a medium build, shoulder-length blonde hair and an unkempt appearance.

pair.t: The body of Satomi Mitarai was found by a teacher after her attacker returned to class in bloody clothes.
pair.h: Mitarai's body was found by a teacher after her killer returned to their classroom covered in blood.

pair.t: Witnesses told police a gas canister exploded to start the fire in a multilevel building which houses the Ycua Bolanos supermarket, a food court and a parking garage, causing the bottom floor to collapse.
pair.h: Television footage showed several levels of the multi-level supermarket covered in soot, including the lower level parking garage.

pair.t: Gross domestic product, a measure of total output within the nation's borders, climbed at a 3% annual pace in the April-June period.
pair.h: Annual rate increase of 3% in second quarter much lower than forecasts.

pair.t: Intel has decided to push back the launch date for its 4-GHz Pentium 4 desktop processor to the first quarter of 2005.
pair.h: Intel would raise the clock speed of the company's flagship Pentium 4 processor to 4 GHz.

pair.t: The last Australian to win Miss Universe was Perth's Kerry Anne Wells in 1972.
pair.h: Not since 1972 has an Australian woman been named Miss Universe.

pair.t: The city continued to grow through much of the 20th century.
pair.h: The city continued to grow, but its services deteriorated.

pair.t: This growth proved short-lived, for a Swedish invasion ( 1655-56 ) devastated the flourishing city of Warsaw.
pair.h: Warsaw was invaded by the Swedes in 1655, and the city was devastated.

pair.t: A car bomb exploded outside a U.S. military base near Baji.
pair.h: A car bomb exploded outside a U.S. military base near Beiji.

pair.t: Because of Reagan's economic strategy, the federal budget deficit ballooned.
pair.h: Reagan's economic strategy led to huge federal budget deficits.

pair.t: Once called the "Queen of the Danube," Budapest has long been the focal point of the nation and a lively cultural centre.
pair.h: Budapest was once popularly known as the "Queen of the Danube."

pair.t: Vanunu, 49, was abducted by Israeli agents and convicted of treason in 1986 after discussing his work as a mid-level Dimona technician with Britain's Sunday Times newspaper.
pair.h: Vanunu's disclosures in 1968 led experts to conclude that Israel has a stockpile of nuclear warheads.

pair.t: Pakistani officials announced that two South African men in their custody had confessed to planning attacks at popular tourist spots in their home country.

pair.t: Meadows scored a bit part in a January episode of "Law & Order".

pair.t: Authorities say Monica Meadows, who has appeared in catalogs and magazines, is in stable condition.
pair.h: Monica Meadows is in stable condition.

pair.t: According to tradition, they founded Tenochtitlan ( "Place of the High Priest Tenoch" ) after much wandering when they saw on an island in Lake Texcoco the sign that their god Huitzilopochtli had indicated -- an eagle perched on a cactus, eating a serpent .
pair.h: They saw an eagle perched on a cactus eating a serpent.

pair.t: Prosecutors were still expected to unseal an 11-count manslaughter indictment against the ferry's captain, Michael Gansas. He violated procedure by his absence from the wheelhouse during docking, when Smith lost control of the ferry.
pair.h: Mr Smith entered his guilty plea to 11 counts of manslaughter and also to lying to investigators about his medical history, under an agreement reached with prosecutors.

pair.t: The Golden Flyers set a school record this year with 16 victories.
pair.h: The Golden Flyers set a school record with 16 victories.

pair.t: The city ferry fleet shuttles about 70,000 people a day between Staten Island and Manhattan, a 5.2-mile trip across New York Harbor that takes about 25 minutes.

pair.t: Rozsa ( Rose ) Hill , the third hill near the river, lies north of Castle Hill.
pair.h: Rozsa Hill lies north of Castle Hill.

pair.h: There are many benefits from breast-feeding.

pair.h: The AU said it may send a 2 000-strong peacekeeping force.

pair.h: Smoking marijuana does not increase the risk of developing oral cancer.

pair.t: Six hostages in Iraq were freed.

pair.t: The GDP report showed growth in business outlays advanced at a solid 8.9% pace.
pair.h: The GDP was a disappointing report.

pair.t: Israel plans to increase the share of gas in its energy balance to 25 percent by 2025 from the current 1 percent.
pair.h: Currently the share of natural gas in Israel's energy system amounts to no more than one percent.

pair.t: A senior al-Qaeda operative who was said to be planning an attack on Heathrow Airport has been arrested.
pair.h: Despite rumors, the British Home Office denied any specific threat had been made to target Heathrow airport.

pair.t: For women who are HIV negative or who do not know their HIV status, breastfeeding should be protected, promoted and supported for six months.
pair.h: For HIV-positive mothers, the decision about whether or not to breastfeed a child can be difficult.

pair.t: Saudi Arabia was boosting its production.
pair.h: Saudi Arabia was boosting its own production.

pair.t: The city's motto is Contemnit procellas, which means, "It defies the storms."
pair.h: The city's motto is, appropriately, "Contemnit procellas" ( "It defies the storms").

pair.h: Mark Hacking was booked into the Salt Lake County Jail on Monday.

pair.t: At the southeastern tip of the city, Xochimilco, another small town subsumed by the city, is a popular tourist destination because of its chinampas, or "floating gardens," boats made out of reeds on which the Indians have grown plants since pre-Columbian times.
pair.h: Xochimilco is a popular tourist attraction because of its chinampas, or floating gardens.

pair.t: Google Inc. is delaying its IPO by a week because of logistical problems related to institutional investors registering to bid on the shares.

pair.h: Industry, retail stores, finance, and communications are all centered in the capital.

pair.h: Mr Vanderford said he filmed his own mock execution in a friend's garage to show how the media could be fooled.

pair.t: Reagan was seriously wounded by a bullet fired by John Hinckley Jr. in an attempted assassination on March 30, 1981.

pair.t: Jennifer Hawkins is the 21-year-old beauty queen from Australia.
pair.h: Jennifer Hawkins is Australia's 21-year-old beauty queen.

pair.h: Dayton is located in Ohio.

pair.t: Winning Team John C. Harsanyi, John F. Nash and Reinhard Selten were jointly awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics. The three professors were singled out for their unique contributions to game theory, derived from studies of games such as poker or chess, in which players have to think ahead and devise a strategy based on expected countermoves from opponents.
pair.h: Three scholars shared a Nobel Prize for their studies about the game theory.
